p: For 1:4 reaction mixtures ( Figure 3 b), we observed an increased reaction rate compared to 1:3 mixtures. Complete consumption of Si was observed at 1225 °C after only 6 h, at 1200 °C after 16 h, and at 1150 °C after 40 h. At the same time, it is clear that excess B promotes the formation of β-SiB 3, which was obtained in substantial amounts (25–50%) at 1150–1200 °C after 40 h. Figure 4 illustrates with PXRD patterns the evolution of the product with time at 1175 °C. We observed significant formation of SiB 6 at 1225 °C after 16 h.
